root: ^SAFIYA:What brings you to our village? I want to believe that you do not want any trouble.
^Nolwazi takes a deep breath and reaches into her bag, retrieving the papyrus with the image of Edrice and Ahmed.
^NOLWAZI:I've been sent on a quest by my grandmother to find the Saqqara Tombs. This papyrus is the only clue I have. I wonder if you can help me.
^SAFIYA:That papyrus... how on earth did you get it? It’s linked to our family tree. Come with me.
^Safiya leads Nolwazi to an old, weathered house. Inside, they find Edrice, the village elder, surrounded by historical artifacts. Edrice looks up from her work as Safiya and Nolwazi enter.
^SAFIYA: (to Edrice) Mama, this traveller seeks the Saqqara Tombs. She has something that might peak your interest.
^Edrice regards Nolwazi with a knowing look.

^EDRICE: (nodding) Let me see. Oh dear child, I knew your dearest grandmother, she was an amazing woman. However, I cannot help you, I do not have all the pieces to the puzzle you seek to solve.  That necklace you see on the papyrus; it was a gift from my first love Ahmed. You see, it was stolen from me by my snake of a neighbour Femi.

^EDRICE: You will need to retrieve it, but be careful and do not trust her. She has been wanting to bargain that necklace off for years but has never done so because she understands the value that necklace holds to her and I. Treat her with respect, when greeting her say السلام عليكم" (pronounced as "as-salamu alaykum"), it means peace be with you. She will be more open to you, when you greet her with respect. .
^Nolwazi: Thank you Edrice. I will go to her.
